body_html:
The dependence on threading does seem suspicious. Could you try to test what happens if you only set one of the threading params to 1? In other words, run with

config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = 1

or

config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = 1
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
body_text:
The dependence on threading does seem suspicious. Could you try to test what happens if you only set one of the threading params to 1? In other words, run with
config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = 1
or
config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = 1
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
body:
The dependence on threading does seem suspicious. Could you try to test what happens if you only set one of the threading params to 1? In other words, run with

config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = 1

or

config_proto.intra_op_parallelism_threads = 1
config_proto.inter_op_parallelism_threads = $num_cores
